question: My son is currently in the hospital for bleeding.  He was put on colazal and steroids which neither helped.  We finally tried the Remicade.  He also has nephrogenic diabetes insipuds.  Which is his kidneys not being able to recognize the hormone ADH.  He drinks 4 liter of water a day at age. 8.  Since the remicade he now drinks 8 to 10 liter a day.  He is on his normal NDI meds of hydrochlorthiazide and amiloride and potassium.  Our docs at Stanford do not know any other patient with these two diseases.  Can anyone help with why this has altered his first disease and has dcause such a horrific thirst, urination. It is almost as if his medications do not work with the remicade.Renay
title: Remicade and Nephrogenci diabetes insipids
